intro: Dryandra cypholoba, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dryandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to Western Australia and is characterized by its slender, zigzagging stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces dense clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically borne on leafless stems. It is a shrub that thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the dry, Mediterranean climate of its native region. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
